column1: Colonel Fei Junlong (simplified Chinese: ???; traditional Chinese: ???; pinyin: Fi Jnlng) (born 1965) is a Chinese military pilot and an astronaut.
He flew on the second manned spaceflight of the Shenzhou program.
In the PLAAF, he was a pilot, flight trainer and flight technology inspector.

column2: Fi was selected for the CNSA astronaut program in 1998.

column1: He was in the final five selected for the Shenzhou 5 flight.
He was the commander on the Shenzhou 6 flight that launched October 12, 2005, with Ni H?ishng serving as flight engineer).
He was married in 1991 and has one son.

column2: During his personal time he dabbles in fine arts.
The asteroid 9512 Feijunlong was named after him.
